intro: Pouzolzia dalzellii, commonly known as the Dalzell's pouzolzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has alternate, ovate to elliptical leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Pouzolzia dalzellii is characterized by its fibrous root system and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
